items.sentence: Tom picked up the walkie-talkie and started talking.
Tom planned to talk to Mary the first chance he got.
Tom said he intends to go to Australia next October.
Tom said he saw Mary at the movie theater with John.
Tom said he thought Mary was still living in Boston.
Tom said he wanted to try to swim across this river.
Tom says that he wants me to go to Boston with Mary.
My older brother finished his homework very quickly.
Would you go to the supermarket and get some butter?
Do you really think that Tom is going to believe me?
Do you think Tom might like to go to Boston with us?
Do you think that anybody would care if we did that?
Do you want to know how Tom became fluent in French?
I don\'t really want to pay that much for a new car.
I don\'t speak French, but I understand it a little.
I don\'t think I could forgive myself if I did that.
I don\'t think Tom and Mary have anything in common.
I don\'t think Tom is in the mood to work right now.
The first step is realizing that you have a problem.
The more I think about it, the less I understand it.
